title: Walker Evans - Catalogue of the Collection (Art Photography Eboo
description:
Walker Evans: Catalogue of the Collection
Judith Keller / 1995 / 416 pages / PDF / 258 MB

Walker Evans is widely recognized as one of the greatest American photographers of the twentieth century, and the Getty Museum owns one of the most comprehensive collections of his work, including more of his vintage prints than any other museum in the world. This lavishly illustrated volume brings together for the first time all of the MuseumÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Walker Evans holdings. 

Included here are familiar imagesÃ¢â‚¬â€such as EvansÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s photographs of tenant farmers and their families, made in the 1930s and later published in Let Us Now Praise Famous MenÃ¢â‚¬â€and images that are much less familiarÃ¢â‚¬â€such as the photographs Evans made in the 1940s of the winter quarters of the Ringling Brothers circus, or his very late Polaroids, made in the 1970s. In addition, many previously unpublished Evans photographs, and variant croppings of classic images, appear here for the first time. 

Author Judith Keller has written a lively, informative text that places these photographs in the larger context of EvansÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life and career and the cultureÃ¢â‚¬â€especially the popular cultureÃ¢â‚¬â€of the time. In so doing, she has produced an indispensible volume for anyone interested in the history of photography or American culture in the twentieth century. 

Also included is the most comprehensive bibliography on Walker Evans published to date.
